content:
Why do we have mem_inter_eq and mem_inter_iff, and why is the former the simp lemma? I can see we have a few more lemmas like this - I've heard it's maybe because dsimp didn't used to be able to use iffs?

Would a PR to remove the _eq lemmas here, change the iff ones to simp, and fix any resulting issues be welcome? It's slightly odd to my eyes to have a lemma which is "this Prop equals another Prop" instead of phrasing it as iff.
iirc for some prop lemmas, the eq version don't utilize propext but the iff ones do. In this case, both lemmas are propext
This might be a holdover from when dsimp couldn't use iff lemmas
I wouldn't find it worth it to make a PR myself, but I'd happily approve one if you want to make it :)
I'm confused why you even thought that was what that was, Yaël, when it very clearly is not.
@Anne Baanen I'm happy to do so, I just thought it was worth asking before I did so I wasn't told I shouldn't have done so.
